field.label: Authentication Type
field.helpText: Select the authentication type to connect with the service. When using User Credentials, provide the User Name and Password on this tab. When using OAuth 2.0, provide the Client ID and Client Secret on the OAuth 2.0 tab.

field.label: Service URL
field.helpText: URL to REST APIs, you can change the instance name [na7] and version [v50.0]

field.label: User Name
field.helpText: Enter the Salesforce User Name.

field.label: Password
field.helpText: Enter the combination of the Salesforce password and the security token. For example, if your password is "MyPassword" and your security token is "Token", you would enter "MyPasswordToken".

field.label: Authentication URL
field.helpText: URL for Salesforce Authentication.

field.label: Level of Parents
field.helpText: The level of depth of parent relationships, choose an integer between 0 and 5. 0 means do not import any parents, 5 means import up to 5 levels of parents. REST API supports Query up to 5 levels of parents, but Bulk API V2.0 supports 1 level of parents

field.label: Import Children
field.helpText: The level of depth of children relationships. None means do not import any children, Without Parents means import only children without their parents, With Parents means import children and their direct parents

field.label: Operation API
field.helpText: The API to be used in the operations.

field.label: Limit Number of Documents
field.helpText: Select to limit the number of documents to return

field.label: Number of Documents
field.helpText: Number of documents to return

field.label: Include Deleted
field.helpText: If checked, deleted records will also be returned in results (QueryAll)

field.label: Log SOQL
field.helpText: If checked, the full SOQL appears in process logs after a process is executed. The SOQL includes both the SOQL and the input parameters. Having the full SOQL is useful when troubleshooting process issues, such as when a request in your SOQL fails.

field.label: Query Page Size
field.helpText: Specifies the number of records returned in a single request. The minimum is 200, and the maximum is 2000 for REST APIs, no limit for Bulk APIs. If you don’t provide a value for this parameter, the server uses a default value based on the service.

field.label: Assignment Rule ID (Optional)
field.helpText:
The ID of an assignment rule to run for a Case or a Lead. The assignment rule can be active or inactive. The ID can be retrieved by querying the AssignmentRule object.
• TRUE. Active assignment rules are applied for created or updated Accounts, Cases, or Leads.
• FALSE. Active assignment rules are not applied for created or updated Accounts, Cases, or Leads.
• Valid AssignmentRule ID. The given AssignmentRule is applied for created Accounts, Cases, or Leads.
• TRUE and FALSE are not case-sensitive.
